artist: Artist: Utagawa Kuniteru II; Publisher: Daikokuya Heikichi
creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription: Scenes from top to bottom, left to right: 千秋楽手打之図 {Senshūraku teuchi no zu} (Picture of the concluding program); 弓取之図 {Yumitori no zu} (Picture of the bow-twirling ceremony); 行司部屋之図 {Gyōji beya no zu} (Picture of the referee room); 仕度部屋図 {Shitaku beya no zu} (Picture of the dressing room); 木戸大札場之図 {Kido daifudaba no zu} (Picture of the sumo arena\'s accounting space); 木戸内之図 {Kido uchi no zu} (Picture of the sumo arena)
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: 応需一雄斎国輝画図 {ōju Ichiyūsai Kuniteru ga zu}
text: This is the left sheet of a three-print composition illustrating on-stage and off-stage scenes during a sumo tournament that was organized as a fundraiser. From top to bottom, left to right, these are the concluding program, the bow-twirling ceremony that signals the end of a tournament day, the room where the referees assemble, the wrestler’s dressing room, the sumo arena's accounting space, and the sumo arena.
title: Picture of a Thriving Grand Fundraising Sumo Tournament
